results.title: Strangers in Paradise
results.brief_description: Experience the wonder down under - Australia, one of the most exciting, unspoilt and undiscovered destinations left on earth. Tourism is now Australia’s second biggest industry. “Strangers in Paradise” follows a group of American and British tourists on 10 day tour of Australia .. to find out what the tourists think and if the brochures really deliver.

results.title: Strangers at the door
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Maxine Samuels and John Howe
results.brief_description: It had been a hard journey for immigrants Jan Laluckey and his family. But on arrival in Quebec, the New World, all their hopes for a new and better life were dampened when immigration officials refused to allow Kasia, Jan’s daughter, to remain. During a routine medical examination it was found that Kasia had contracted an infectious eye disease. In the end she was separated from her family and sent back to Europe alone. Cast: George Popovich, Elaine Reade, Maruska Stankova, Vlasta Vrana.

results.title: Stranger than paradise
results.creator_credit: Cinesthesia Productions, Sara Driver and Jim Jarmusch
results.brief_description: Jim Jarmusch’s debut feature is a dead pan masterpiece, utilising to great effect its low key performances, static camera movement and grungy, sparse locations. Shot in high contrast black and white by Tom Decillo (who went on to direct ‘Johnny Suede’ and ‘Living in Oblivion’), this quirky road movie presents a unique outsiders view of America and the characters that inhabit its fringes. Structured as a series of three vignettes spaning New York, Cleveland and Florida, ‘Stranger than Paradise’ stars John Lurie (who also wrote the music) as Wille, a laidback hipster whose meandering lifestyle is briefly disrupted when his Hungarian, teenage cousin (Eszter Balint) comes to stay. The films cool, episodic style, slipping casually between melancholy and off the wall humour became a distinct Jarmusch trade mark, fine tuned in later films such as ‘Down by law’, ‘Mystery Train’, ‘Night on earth’ and ‘Dead man’. Cast also includes Richard Edson. (Awards: Winner of the Cannes 1984 Camera d’Or for Best First Feature)

results.title: Stranger in his own country
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Society’s Training Centre in preparing mentally handicapped young people to live and work as relatively independent adults, making the most of their abilities and living in the normal community.

results.title: Stranger's kiss
results.creator_credit: Kill Productions, Douglas Dilge and Matthew Chapman
results.brief_description: Hollywood, 1955, and independent film director Stanley (Peter Coyote) is eking out production day by day on a film financed by gangster Frank Silva, and starring Silva’s girlfriend, Carol (Victoria Tennant) as the leading lady, Betty. Stanley’s film is a love story about a boxer, a gangster, and a girl, and in a case of life imitating art, the leading actor (Blaine Novak) falls in love with Carol/Betty, unbeknownst that she already has a boyfriend who also happens to he a vicious gangster and the financer of the film. This film about a film is supposedly a fictionalised account on what went on behind the production of Kubrick’s “Killer’s kiss”, and has earned comparisons to a later production - Woody Allen’s “Bullets over Broadway” (1994). Cast also includes Richard Romanus and Dan Shor.

results.title: Strange planet
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Stavros Kazantzidis, Anastasia Sideris and Emma-Kate Croghan
results.brief_description: Emma-Kate Croghan made a great splash with her debut feature “Love and other catastrophes”; this, her follow-up work, was less successful, being a somewhat formulaic tale about love and destiny. The narrative centres around three friends, Alice, Judy and Sally, who are adrift in their late 20s, looking for love, career prospects and direction in life. Unbeknownst to them, three eligible men are also on similar paths, dealing with a variety of catastrophes and missteps. Will these six find love, career fulfilment and buffering from the trials and tribulations of life? Probably. Cast includes: Claudia Karvan, Naomi Watts, Alice Garner, Tom Long, Felix Williamson and Hugo Weaving.

results.title: Strange invaders
results.brief_description: This entertaining animation tells the story of a strange evening in the night of a happy husband and wife. The nightmare begins with a child like creature landing head first in their house, its feet flaming. At first they are very happy with this odd foundling and like many new parents take numerous photos of the arrival. Aided by a telescope, the baby communicates with its own - chaos is inevitable. The wife leaves, taking the dog. The sad man is left a great mess. The theme of this comedic short is the trials and joys brought about with the arrival of a child.

results.title: Strange interview
results.creator_credit: Jam Handy Organization and Haford Kerbawy
results.brief_description: The story of Bill Barker, the owner of a small plant, who sees his production falling off and the quality of the work going down. Believing the situation calls for rigid discipline, he sacrifices personal warmth and understanding in his relations with his men. This attitude only aggravates matters until finally, in a dream sequence, Benjamin Franklin makes him see that his human relations can stand a lot of improvement.

results.title: Strange inner tube
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach Studios, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Hal Roach and Del Lord
results.brief_description: A Hal Roach chaotic romp as would-be taxi drivers train using bumper cars. After graduating from taxi school, Billy, Ben and Clyde find themselves involved with a gang of jewel smugglers headed by Frisco Fanny and Flash Fred. Cast includes Billy Gilbert, Ben Blue, Clyde Cook. Charley Rogers, Yola d’Avril, Richard Cramer, Bud Jamison.
